name: La Residenza dell'Orafo

reviews.text: ...we weren't expecting much (it says B & B ...etc)...but was pleasantly surprise after " hotel" stays in venice, and rome. ..clean comfortable room and ideal location....staff was most friendly and helpful in getting us to settle in. and providing useful info about florence......will not hesitate to recommend to anyone interested in visiting florence.
reviews.title: Excellent !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights following a 7 day cruise. A perfect ending to a great vacation. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was just the way it was pictured on their website. Very comfortable room. The balcony faced the street which provided fantastic people watching. The location was just a block from the train station and walking distance to all the major sites. Never had to use a taxi or public transportation. My wife particularly was pleased to be so close to all the stores and the open air markets. We will stay again when we visit Florence!
reviews.title: Amazing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was completely cute, completely clean, but also very tiny. To be clear, the hotel absolutely has bigger rooms, we just rented the smallest size.
reviews.title: Cute but tiny room -- friendliest service in Italy

reviews.text: Since we didn't need a big room anyway, it was the perfect place to stay while we explored Florence.
reviews.title: PERFECT! COULD NOT HAVE ASKED FOR MORE.

reviews.text: The people we met who worked at the hotel were absolutely the nicest people we encountered in the entire country. They bent over backwards to make us comfortable, answer our questions, etc. Also, the fruit plate they brought to us upon our arrival was such a nice and unexpected touch.
reviews.title: Assistance with a smile!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B is located less than a block from the train station entrance so it's a great location. Only a few blocks from all the other major sites in Florence. No need to every get in a vehicle. Once arriving at the place, you need to ring the buzzer to have them let you up. We kept pulling on the door for a while before we figured out you had to push.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms, pleasant staff

reviews.text: This little B&B is located on the second floor (by American standards) of a four story building. There are other small B&Bs located in the same building. The desk is manned during the day, but not at night. The public areas of the B&B are extremely limited - front desk and a couch - that's it. But, they can handle your luggage if you arrive before check-in or want to store your luggage after check-out time.
reviews.title: Love B&B so much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the amber room. It came with a tight bathroom - very small shower. The door was a pocket door, which I liked because it took up less room. The room had a soft lit soothing color scheme. Minimal furnishings - no rugs or carpet. A wardrobe in place of a closet.
reviews.title: This was the nicest place we stayed during our entire Italian vacation!

reviews.text: They provided a map of Florence and a small platter of fruit, drinks and snacks. Breakfast was a block away at a cafe. It included OJ, a pastry, fruit salad (or something else) and coffee/tea.
reviews.title: Lovely clean rooms with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have one complaint about this place and it is not the B&B's fault - there was a lot of moving of furniture or something upstairs that was very noisy. It started early and went on late. I don't know why --- we were there for 4 nights and it happened on multiple occasions. It's funny, we never heard any of the other rooms - coming or going.
reviews.title: Great location and place to stay in Florence

reviews.text: Excellent, top-quality hostel right in the heart of Florence and for a very reasonable price. Giulia is the epitome of the best of Italian hospitality, bursting with contagious cheerfulness and extreme helpfulness. She also has the good habit of showering you with various little presents, which for us also a included a bottle of very drinkable Chianti upon our departure. I can only recommend.
reviews.title: Cozy place, with full of surprises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location to the train, bus and to the city was excellent. We arrived early evening on a hot day and were pleasantly welcomed by Giulia, who had a cold drink and nibblies waiting for us. Our room was very spacious and clean. It had tea/coffee facilties and a lovely round table with fruit and biscuits on it and 2 tub chairs, it did not disappoint. The staff treated you like a friend and were full of helpful information. We highly recommend La Residenza.
reviews.title: Amazing Find
Great Stay in Florence
reviews.text: We really like this B&B for many reasons. The room is always clean and lovely. The location is great.The staffs are excellent and kind. They always gave us a useful information for sightseeing and restaurants. In addition to this,they always gave us a homely feeling and warm atmopshere even my small son also likes the staffs in this B&B. What we feel comfortable is suprising present for the cake and wine !! This kind of hospitality is very memorable.
If we have a chance to come back to florence, we surely book this B&B again.
reviews.title: "Great Location!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You couldn't be better placed to enjoy the wonders of Florence. You are literally a 5 minutes walk from the bus and train station and close to all the sites of the city. What we loved about Florence was not only the beautiful sites but how easily you could access it all on foot. We dropped our hire car off in Florence before moving on to Rome. The Eurpocar is also very close only a 10 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Unparalleled hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can be very short about this one: if they have a room available.... BOOK IT! FANTASTIC location right in the city centre of Florence and just a few steps away for the bus station. Great rooms with a romantic touch, comfortable bed and nice bathroom. Staff INCREDIBLY friendly and really made you feel welcome (Thanks, Greta!). Never had a hotel / B&B where they offered you a present when leaving and nice treats when arriving in the room. Would recommend this B&B to everybody. Maybe the only negative part would be the breakfast, which you have to take at a bar nearby. Not really bad, but not great either (great cappucino though!). However, all the positive parts about this B&B faaaar outweigh this tiny negative part.
reviews.title: Don't look any further....

reviews.text: BOOK BOOK BOOK!
reviews.title: Excellent hospitality and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the first time my husband and I have ever stayed in a B&B and it was such a pleasant experience. The staff were very friendly and helpful, doing everything they can to make us feel warm and welcome. We were even given free drinks and snacks in the afternoon!
reviews.title: Very nice little B&B, very friendly staff

reviews.text: The rooms were cutely decorated, relatively large, very clean, and well-maintained. The location was also very perfect as it was a minute walk from the Santa Maria Novella Train station, and about 2 blocks away from both the food and leather markets.
reviews.title: We love this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really good location, about a 5 minute walk from the train station and within walking distance to all of the main sites, markets and look out point (about a 30 min walk to see fantastic views).
reviews.title: Genuine Excellent Italian Hospitality

description: In the heart of Florence, one of the most romantic and magical cities of the world, right at the exit of the train Station Santa Maria Novella, a step away from the Palace of Congresses (Conferences Palace) and from the historical center a Bed and Breakfast has recently been opened: “La Residenza dell'Orafo” with cozy and comfortable rooms, great service and an excellent quality price ratio.
